data.title: Pâques en Terre sainte : Reportage de Benjamin Barthe, correspondant RSR Jérusalem
data.summary: La Terre sainte s'apprête à célébrer Pâques, mais les chrétiens des territoires occupés n'ont pas le coeur à la fête. La police israélienne a conditionné l'entrée des fidèles dans la vieille ville de Jérusalem, haut lieu des cérémonies, à l'obtention d'un permis, délivré au compte gouttes. Une mesure prise au nom de l'ordre public, mais que les chrétiens palestiniens jugent discriminatoire.

data.title: Entretien avec Olivier Rolin, écrivain, à l'occasion de la sortie de son ouvrage "Bakou, derniers jours" (Ed. du Seuil)
data.summary:
"Olivier Rolin publie aux Editions du Seuil "Bakou, derniers jours".
Un livre singulier qui relève tout à la fois du journal de voyage et du journal intime.
Il y a six ans, dans Suite Hôtel Crystal (paru dans la collection de Maurice Olender, «La Librairie du XXIe siècle») Olivier Rolin avait mis en scène …sa propre mort ou, à tout le moins, celle de son narrateur. L’événement survenait dans une chambre d’hôtel, à Bakou, en Azerbaïdjan. En couverture de ce livre, on pouvait lire: Olivier Rolin, Boulogne Billancourt 1947- Bakou 2009.
Six ans plus tard, l’auteur de L’invention du monde a choisi de revenir à Bakou et d’y demeurer suffisamment longtemps afin, écrit-il, de« laisser à la fiction de ma mort sur les bords de la Caspienne une chance, raisonnable de se réaliser ».
C’est cette étrange promenade que conte Olivier Rolin dans Bakou, derniers jours, un livre agrémenté de ses photographies.
Bakou, derniers jours est un livre précieux qui traite de l’exil et de la disparition, sources de l’écriture.
Invité de Presque rien sur presque tout, Olivier Rolin, Prix Femina pour Port Soudan en 1994, s’explique sur ces mémoires…d’outre-tombe!"

chapters.excerpt: * Genève-ville : 20100402, l'autisme est une maladie incurable mais désormais les diagnostics précoces permettent aux enfants qui en sont atteints de se mieux développer. Un centre de consultation spécialisé en autisme a été créé à Genève dont l'objectif est notamment d'avancer la détection de l'autisme.

XVM02 - XV002456/01 (IMTH Evénementielle)

chapters.excerpt: * St-Maurice : 20100402, les fidèles catholiques effectuent le chemin de croix de Notre-Dame du Scex en famille. Cette année, cette tradition est marquée par les affaires de pédophilie qui touchent l'Eglise catholique.

* Seine-St-Denis : Tremblay-en-France, 20100402, un reportage sur le trafic de drogue dans la cité du Grand Ensemble de Tremblay-en-France, a entraîné une flambée de violence. Le reportage, intitulé "Mon voisin est un dealer", a été diffusé sur TF1, dans l'émission "Haute définition". Le jour même de la diffusion de cette enquête journalistique, la police a effectué une opération anti-drogue dans la cité. En représailles, 2 jours plus tard, un autobus a été incendié près du lieu où s'est déroulé cette opération de police. Une polémique s'en est suivit.

* FRANCE, Genève-ville, Lausanne : 20100402, le député européen et socialiste français, MELENCHON Jean-Luc a insulté un jeune journaliste français lors d'une itw. Cette séquence a largement été reprise sur les différents sites internet. Désormais, les propos et les activités des politiciens, y compris en Suisse, peuvent être repris sur internet, sortis de leur contexte, obligeant ainsi à des changements de comportement de la part des hommes politiques.

* Genève-ville, Paudex : 20100402 et archives, la plupart des caisses de pension ainsi que la Fondation Ethos s'opposent à la décharge à accorder aux ex-dirigeants d'UBS SA. Le vote, qui devra juger du sort notamment des ex-présidents OSPEL Marcel et KURER Peter, interviendra lors de l'assemblée des actionnaires qui se tiendra le 20100414. Cependant, les actionnaires suisses ne représentent que 8% des voix alors qu'UBS SA a lancé une opération pour convaincre les investisseurs étrangers de blanchir les ex-dirigeants, l'issue du vote est donc incertaine.

* Bienne : 20100402, les gorges du Taubenloch sont à nouveau ouvertes au public après plusieurs mois de travaux destinés à sécuriser le sentier pédestre. La falaise a été stabilisée et des filets ont été installés afin de prévenir les risques d'éboulement.
* Sion : 20100402, le président du FC Sion CONSTANTIN Christian est connu pour pour être colérique et très exigeant. Son comportement est apprécié par certains footballeurs et redouté par d'autres.

Ce sera l'invité du 19 30 occasions de revenir avec lui sur les affaires qui agitent le club sédunois depuis plusieurs jours, on revient maintenant sur l'affaire du demandeur d'asile nigérian mort pendant son expulsion il y a 15 jours à l'aéroport de Zürich, on apprend aujourd'hui qu'il vivait en Suisse sous une fausse identité, mais les autorités nigérianes avaient certifié sa nationalité, ce qui était légalement suffisants pour son renvoi, selon l'Office fédéral des migrations, mais de son côté, l'ONG alémanique à Augusta offs s'étonne qu'on puisse expulser quelqu'un sans que son identité exacte ne soit quoi.


Locuteur MS2 (0:03:33 > 0:03:52) [91%] : 
à l'étranger, maintenant, la tension est à son comble à trembler, une cité de la banlieue nord de Paris, plus aucun bus ne circule jusqu'à nouvel ordre, les chauffeurs refusent tout simplement d'entrer dans la cité après qu'un de leurs véhicules s'est fait incendier et plusieurs autres caillasser à l'origine des émeutes, une chasse aux dealers, lancée par la police en début de semaine, Viviane Epinay.


Locuteur FS5 (0:03:53 > 0:04:09) [97%] : 
Un cocktail Molotov lancé contre un bus en marche et le feu se propage à toute vitesse les passagers et le chauffeur ont à peine le temps de s'extraire du véhicule par miracle ni morts ni blessés, l'agression a eu lieu mercredi au coeur de la cité du Grand Ensemble à Tremblay en.


Locuteur MS6 (0:04:09 > 0:04:22) [88%] : 
France : en 2005, monsieur Sarkozy était venu nous voir, qu'on a vu les événements en 2005, il nous avait promis qu'il ne mettrait le paquet on au niveau de la de la sécurité, là on s'aperçoit avec les éléments qu'il a eu hier soir il y a, il y a rien eu qui a été fait.


Locuteur FS5 (0:04:22 > 0:04:51) [94%] : 
Plusieurs dizaines de conducteurs en colère sont en grève indéfinie, les habitants de Tremblay, vivent dans l'angoisse, la violence contre les transports en commun n'est pas nouvelle dans la banlieue nord de Paris, pourtant, la ville de Tremblay, proche de l'aéroport de Roissy était jusque-là plutôt tranquille le feu aux poudres c'est la perquisition d'un appartement de la cité butin plusieurs centaines de milliers d'euros de la drogue et des armes 4 trafiquants ont été arrêtés, le ministre de l'Intérieur, Brice Hortefeux, s'est lui rendu sur place hier.


Locuteur MS6 (0:04:52 > 0:05:05) [90%] : 
Nous ne lâcherons rien : les petites crapules sont pas propriétaires de leur quartier, donc nous allons mobiliser, nous allons densifier nos actions multiplié les initiatives et donner des opérations coup de poing la loi et l'ordre, c'est pour tout le monde, la suite du poisson.


Locuteur FS5 (0:05:05 > 0:05:09) [90%] : 
Le maire de Tremblay-en-France, s'inquiète lui de l'urgence sociale dans sa commune.


Locuteur MS6 (0:05:09 > 0:05:23) [86%] : 
Donc même si c'est pour travailler sur le terrain, sur le fond, donner les moyens, il est bienvenue, si c'est pour faire de la communication et laisser quand même, avec son gouvernement des quartiers en difficulté comme Tremblay et les autres, alors là je dis non.


Locuteur FS5 (0:05:23 > 0:05:32) [97%] : 
La descente de police, a eu lieu lundi, avant la diffusion sur TF1 d'un reportage sur le trafic de drogue justement dans la cité du Grand Ensemble à Tremblay en France.


Locuteur MS2 (0:05:34 > 0:05:50) [89%] : 
2 cosmonautes russes et une américaine, se sont envolés, tôt ce matin depuis le Kazakhstan à bord d'une fusée Soyouz, direction la Station spatiale internationale des astronautes lanceront, entre autres, un nouveau programme expérimental pour tenter de détecter à l'avance les tremblements de terre.


Locuteur MS2 (0:05:53 > 0:06:22) [93%] : 
Et retour sur Terre qui dit week- end de Pâques dit bouchons sur les routes bien sûr surtout pour emprunter le tunnel du Gothard 7 kilomètres de bouchon actuellement et la situation empire d'heure en heure situation difficile également aux abords du tunnel du Mont- Blanc avec entre 3 et 4 heures d'attente pour rejoint l'Italie, il est préférable de passer par le col du Simplon ou par celui du Grand Saint-Bernard à noter aussi en Suisse romande, la douane de à Genève qui est surchargé avec un kilomètre de bouchon est au croisement de la N12.


Locuteur MS3 (0:06:22 > 0:06:27) [93%] : 
De la 9 comme on le voit sur ces images, on roule en accordéon en direction du Valais entre Lausanne.


Locuteur MS2 (0:06:28 > 0:06:49) [90%] : 
Et puis à Genève, on s'affaire depuis ce matin sur le chantier du futur tram qui reliera la gare Cornavin à Aulnay et Berne la mise en circulation est prévue fin 2011, la pose de rails de croisements nécessite l'interruption plus récent du service de tram sur l'ensemble de la rive droite pendant tout le 8ème de Pâques, les usagers devront donc utiliser bus de remplacement.


Locuteur MS2 (0:06:52 > 0:07:31) [89%] : 
Et on termine par ces images de passion aux Philippines terre peuplée à 80 pourcent de catholiques la commémoration du vendredi 130 tour particulier des dizaines de personnes ont parcouru le chemin de croix, on se flagelle, on le doux tandis que certains volontaires n'ont pas hésité à se faire cloué en croix pour quelques minutes à l'origine si crucifixion avait pour but d'expier des péchés ou de remercier Dieu mais fil disons le spectacle a pris une tournure mercantile dont l'Église s'est désolidarisé voilà c'est la fin de ce journal, merci de l'avoir suivi dans un instant, l'excellent Philippe Jeanneret, qui vous dira tout sur la couleur du ciel en ce début de week- end Pascal, que je vous souhaite excellent à lundi.


Locuteur FS1 (0:07:32 > 0:07:41) [96%] : 
L'info en continu et en vidéo pour en savoir plus avec vos infos sur tous les écrans, TSR Info Point CH.

chapters.excerpt: * Zoug-ville : 20100401, victoire d'EV Zoug, qui a battu le Genève Servette HC sur le score de 2 buts à 1, lors du 4e match des demi-finales des play-offs du Championnat suisse de hockey sur glace LNA. Genève Servette HC et EV Zoug ont tous deux gagnés 2 matchs dans ces play-offs.

sequences.summary:
12:35.59
Zoug-ville : divers plans des 2 buts d' EV Zoug marqués par HOLDEN, Josh et MCTAVISH, Dale, hockeyeurs / divers plans but du Genève Servette HC marqué par TOMS, Jeff, hockeyeur. hockey sur glace, LNA.

MENU 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

0.40 Lisandro celeb 
Barcelona chance 
Inter v CSKA crunch tackle 
Olic chance 

 We’re at the ¼ final stage, and the race for glory is hotting up! 

    

0.47 Teams out 
Messi chance 
Nasri chance 
Wenger reaction 
Fabregas close up  

 This week – as close to fantasy football as you can get. The boys 
from Barca versus the artisans of Arsenal. 
 

    

0.53 ARSENE WENGER 
(ENGLISH) 

 

I HOPE THE MATCH RESPONDS TO THE EXPECTATION AND 
THAT ON TOP OF THAT, WE WILL GET A CONVICING 
VICTORY.  

    

1.02 Crowd shot 
Chamakh goal 
Crunch tackle   
Lyon chances  

 In France, the tie that has a whole nation talking, as the big two 
Lyon and Bordeaux go toe to toe.  

    

1.09 Alliance arena outside 
Fan colour  
Solskjaer goal and celeb 
Bayern players upset  
Beckenbauer b-roll  

 And in Germany, Bayern versus Manchester United is steeped in 
history….we’ll hear from ”Der Kaiser’ Franz Beckenbauer ahead 
of the big match. 

    

1.19 Honda b-roll 
Mourinho cutaway 
Cambiasso celeb 

 Plus - CSKA’s Japanese star Keisuke Honda - on facing 
Mourinho’s Inter at the San Siro. 

    

1.26   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

ARSENAL v BARCELONA BUILD UP 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

1.27 Map to Arsenal  But first, to London where both camps were gearing up for what 
promised to be quite an occasion 

    

1.34 Rainy stadium shots and 
Barca training 
Wenger close up 
Guardiola close up 

 The weather in North London had little respect for its visitors 24 
hours before kick off, but there was no doubt the match itself was 
being held in high regard.  
 

    

1.43 ARSENE WENGER 
(ENGLISH) 
Wenger walking 

 

I HOPE THE MATCH RESPONDS TO THE EXPECTATION AND 
THAT ON TOP OF THAT WE GET A CONVINCING VICTORY. 
THAT WOULD BE HEAVEN FOR US 

 

  

 

1.54 JOSEP GUARDIOLA 
(ENGLISH) 
Guardiola walking 

 

BOTH TEAMS WANT THE BALL BOTH TEAMS WANT TO 
ATTACK AND BOTH TEAMS TRY TO PLAY FOR THE 
AUDIENCE. FOR THE PEOPLE 

 

  

 

2.05 THIERRY HENRY 
(ENGLISH) 
Henry close up training 

 

IT’S GOING TO BE A DIFFICULT GAME. IN THE CHAMPIONS 
LEAGUE IF YOU GO MISSING FOR EVEN ONE SECOND 
THAT CAN BE MORTAL. 

    

2.12 Messi training close up 
Messi goals and celebs 

 Well one player who certainly doesn’t go missing is Lionel Messi – 
the Argentine is admired globally for his outstanding talent.   

    

2.20 ARSENE WENGER 
(ENGLISH) 

 

I BELIEVE THAT MESSI COULD BE IN THE NEXT TEN YEARS 
DOMINANT. 

   

 

2.26 JOSEP GUARDIOLA 
(ENGLISH) 
Messi goal  
Messi dribbling shots 
Messi close up 

 

HE’S STRONG IN ALL THE SKILLS OF THE GAME, ALL. THE 
HEAD THE LEFT FOOT RIGHT FOOT IS FAST ONE AGAINST 
ONE. BUT THE MOST IMPORTANT THING IS HE IS VERY, 
VERY STRONG IN HIS HEAD 

    

2.38 ARSENE WENGER 
(ENGLISH) 
 

Messi goal and celeb 

 

AT FOOTBALL AT THE TOP LEVEL THAT YOU CAN HAVE A 
PLAYER IN THE MIDDLE OF THE PARK WHO TAKES THE 
BALL AND GOES AND SCORES WHEN YOU KNOW HOW 
DIFFICULT THAT IS IN A PUB TEAM, IMAGINE HOW 
DIFFICULT IT IS AT THAT LEVEL. YOU DO NOT SEE THAT 
VERY OFTEN 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

    

2.51 Various Fabregas images  But Thierry Henry believes Arsenal aren’t without their own star 
player. 

    

2.56 THIERRY HENRY 
(ENGLISH) 
 

Fabregas goal and celeb 

 

WHEN HE’S ON TUNE, ARSENAL IS ON TUNE. WHEN HE IS 
NOT THERE, ARSENAL IS STRUGGLING SO ITS GONNA BE 
A VERY DIFFICULT TASK AND ALSO FOR CESC IT’S 
SOMETHING SPECIAL BECAUSE CESC IS A BARCELONA 
FAN. 

    

3.09 Henry goal and celeb 
Henry crouching 
Henry lifting trophy 

 It’ll also be pretty emotional for Henry having left Arsenal two 
seasons ago after nearly a decade there, so naturally he has 
mixed feelings ahead of the tie.   

    

3.20 THIERRY HENRY 
(ENGLISH) 
Henry hug 
Henry training close up 

 

IT’S A FAMILY CLUB, I HAD A GREAT RELATIONSHIP WITH 
THE FANS WITH THE PEOPLE THAT ARE WORKING THERE. 
SO COMING BACK AND SEEING EVERY SINGLE ONE OF 
THEM THAT WILL BE A SPECIAL DAY. 

    

3.33 ARSENE WENGER 
(ENGLISH)  
 

Shots of Henry 

 I BELIEVE THAT HE WE WILL BE PROUD AND HAPPY AND 
OF COURSE A LITTLE BIT MOVED BY THE FACT THAT HE 
WILL GET A WARM WELCOME LIKE HE DESERVES IT AND 
WHEN THE GAME STARTS IT WILL BE THE QUARTER FINAL 
OF THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE WHERE WE WILL TRY TO 
BEAT HIM 

    

3.47 THIERRY HENRY 
(ENGLISH) 
Henry celeb in Arsenal shirt 

 IM JUST SO HAPPY AND GLAD TO GO BACK HOME AS I 
SAID AT THE TIME I BECAME AN ARSENAL FAN IN MY TIME 
THERE SO ITS GOING TO BE SOMETHING SPECIAL FOR ME 

    

3.59 Henry and Guardiola in 
training 
Barca 06 and 09 trophy lifts 
Guardiola with trophy  
Disappointed Wenger, 
Henry and Toure 
Ronaldo goal 
Wenger and Almunia 
reactions  

 Henry is now under the watchful eye of Pep Guardiola who 
guided Barcelona to their second title in the last four years. 
Meanwhile the Champions League still eludes Arsenal but the 
Spaniard has plenty of admiration for Wenger. 

    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

4.12 
 

 

JOSEP GUARDIOLA 
(ENGLISH) 
Nasri goal and celeb 

MR WENGER CHANGED THE MENTALITY OF THIS CLUB.  
TO PUT IN ONE TEAM, ONE STYLE, ONE RECOGNISED 
STYLE. THE PLAYERS PLAY IN THE SAME WAY, AND IN 
THIS WAY ITS ADMIRED ALL ROUND THE WORLD AND FOR 
ME THAT IS THE MOST IMPORTANT THING. 

    

4.27 ARSENE WENGER 
(ENGLISH) 
Babel goal  
Fabregas reaction 

 

OUR AVERAGE AGE WAS TWENTY ONE, TWENTY TWO. 
NOW IT’S TWENTY THREE I BELIEVE WE HAVE LEARNT A 
LOT WE HAVE MADE A BIG STEP FORWARD NOW. FOR US, 
IT’S IMPORTANT TO BE BRAVE, TO RAISE OUR LEVEL TO 
WHERE WE CAN BE NOT TO BE INHIBITED. 

    

4.46 JOSEP GUARDIOLA  
(ENGLISH) 
Eboue goal and celeb 

 

THE MOST IMPORTANT IS NOW THE PEOPLE WHO COME 
HERE FOR ATMOSPHERE FOR THE PEOPLE FOR ARSENAL 
COME HERE TO SEE THE GAME AND ENJOY THIS 
FOOTBALL THAT IS THE MOST IMPORTANT THING. 

 

  

 

4.55 ARSENE WENGER 
(ENGLISH) 
 

Wenger celeb 

 

PEOPLES OPINIONS CAN BE CHANGED BY THE 
PERFORMANCES ON THE PITCH. THAT’S WHAT WE WANT 
TO SHOW. LETS MAKE SURE THAT WE ARE THE BEST 
TEAM  

    

5.03   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

ARSENAL v BARCELONA 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

5.04 Fans 
Team Line Up  
Fabregas on Scoreboard 
Henry on Bench  
Messi in Line Up 
Floodlights  

 In the end Arsenal‘s talisman Fabregas was fit to start. Henry only 
a Barca sub – Messi and the rest aiming to be the first side ever 
to defend the Champions League. 
 

    

5.18 Kick off  
Action plus close ups of 
Messi and Fabregas 

 And they began brilliantly – it’s not just their beauty on the ball but 
their work rate off it – almost like fantasy computer football but 
this was very real. The Gunners looked like little boys lost. 

    

5.31 From a corner Busquets 
forces Almunia into a great 
low save 

 A master class in pass and move – Busquets had the first of half 
a dozen early chances. 

    

5.36 Messi Shot  Messi was next to test Manuel Almunia. 
    

5.40 Ibrahimovic over bar from 6 
yards  
Guardiola reaction to miss 

 Before Ibrahimovic skied a sitter – his coach had clearly missed 
the offside flag. 

    

5.46 Ibrahimovic shot saved one 
handed by Almunia 

 The Swede got the next one on target – but Almunia was having 
an inspired evening.  

    

5.51 Arsenal Triple Save from 
Barcelona 

 As well for his team that he was – an even better stop from Xavi – 
then Song on the line to block from Pedro. Desperation 
defending… 

    

6.04 Nasri Shoots Wide  It took 23 minutes for an Arsenal shot in anger – Nasri wide. 
    

6.10 Arshavin Injured  And Wenger ‘s problems were mounting – Arshavin hobbled off.. 
    

6.15 Gallas injured  William Gallas couldn’t even do that.  
    

6.18 Fabregas yellow  Then his skipper was booked – and banned for the 2nd leg. 
He looked inconsolable. 

    

    



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

6.26 Half Time  
Crowd creating good 
atmosphere  
Zlatan Goal 0-1 

Somehow it was goalless at the break. The Gunner’s fans were 
cheering out of sheer relief. But their side’s luck ran out barely 20 
seconds after the restart.  Ibrahimovic’s first goal against an 
English side at the 11th attempt. 

    

6.40 Bendtner misses header  In a rare Arsenal raid Bendtner should have equalised.  
    

6.45 Zlatan Goal 0-2  And his team were punished – Ibrahimovic again…a fantastic 
finish. 

    

6.54 0-2 scoreboard  25 minutes to go and Wenger had to gamble… 
    

6.58 Walcott on as sub  Sagna sacrificed for Theo Walcott 
    

7.02 Walcott Goal 1-2  Whose impact was immediate – Bendtner’s pass…Valdes might 
have done better. 

    

7.10 Pique Yellow card  But for the first time Barca were rattled – Pique was carded – he’s 
also out for the return leg.  

    

7.17 Messi chance on break 
saved by Almunia’s feet 

 The Catalans were still threatening though – Messi, quiet by his 
standards, kept Almunia honest. 

    

7.22 Henry on as substitute  Before the loudest cheer of the night greeted the entrance of the 
returning Henry. 

    

7.29 Penalty incident and Red 
Card 

 But the Catalans suddenly looked leg weary – a tired challenge 
from Puyol on Fabregas – a penalty – and a red card for the 
Barcelona skipper. 

    

7.39 Fabregas Goal 2-2 
Fabregas Limping back 

 Fabregas kept his nerve against the club where he starred as a 
youth. But it came at a cost – a broken leg - he’s out for the 
season. 

    

7.48 Henry being tightly marked  Meanwhile Henry found shadows in red covering his every move.  
    

7.52 Fabregas back on and 
giving all 

 Amazingly Fabregas was still sprinting with a cracked fibula.  

    

7.56 
 

 

Full Time  2-2 and honour satisfied all round – one of the matches of the 
tournament and it’s likely to be just as good back at the Nou 
Camp.  



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

    

8.05 
 

ARSENE WENGER  
(ENGLISH) 

 WAS AN INTERESTING GAME TONIGHT, WITH TWO TEAMS 
WHO PLAY AND WAS ALWAYS EXCITING. YOU COULD 
SMELL GOALS ALL OVER THE PLACE AT ANY MOMENT 
AND IT WILL BE THE SAME AGAIN NEXT WEEK. 

    

8.20 THIERRY HENRY 
(ENGLISH) 

 AT THE END OF THE DAY, A 2-2 IS A GOOD RESULT AWAY 
FROM HOME AND WE’LL SEE WHAT WE CAN DO OVER 
THERE BUT AS EXPECTED WE KNEW THE GAME WAS 
GOING TO BE DIFFICULT. 

    

8.30 THEO WALCOTT 
(ENGLISH) 
 

Walcott goal and celeb 

 WELL IT’S GOING TO BE TOUGH, YOU KNOW THEIR HOME 
SUPPORT, FANTASTIC TEAM, THEY KEEP THE BALL VERY 
WELL, THEY FRUSTRATE US AT TIMES, BUT IF WE CAN 
JUST GET A GOAL AND SORT OF UPSET THE FANS EARLY 
IT HOPEFULLY CAN CHANGE THE GAME. 

    

8.40   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

LYON v BORDEAUX 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

8.41 Map to Lyon  Next, to Lyon, and a momentous tie for French football. 
    

8.47 Montage pre match fans 
and gv’s 

 The two most successful League 1 clubs were meeting in the first 
all French tie in Champions League history.  And so there was an 
air of excitement around the ground in the build up to kick off.      

    

8.57 VOX POP 1 
(FRENCH) 
Man with long hair 

 

2 FRENCH CLUBS ARE FACING EACH OTHER.  SO THE 
SEMI FINALS WILL FEATURE A FRENCH CLUB, SO THAT’S 
INTERESTING.  

 

   

9.03 VOX POP 2 
(FRENCH) 
 

Man with white hair 

 

THERE’S NO ANTAGONISM; FOR US IT’S A GLORIOUS DAY, 
IT’S ABOUT GETTING TO THE SEMI’S THEN MAYBE THE 
FINAL TOO AND IT’S A PLEASURE TO BE ABLE TO REMIND 
EUROPE THAT FRANCE EXISTS AS WELL.  

 

   

9.12 VOX POP 3 
(FRENCH) 
Man with dark hair 

 

ITS GOOD FOR FRENCH FOOTBALL AND AT LEAST WE’LL 
HAVE A GOOD SEMI FINAL.   

    

9.17 Teams arriving  As the teams arrived at the Stade Gerland the fans debated who 
would come out on top. 

    

9.22 VOX POP 4 
(FRENCH) 
Child 

 

I THINK IT’LL BE 2-1 TO BORDEAUX. THAT WAY LYON WILL 
HAVE IT ALL TO DO IN THE AWAY GAME 

 

   

9.27 VOX POP 5 
(FRENCH) 
Man with dark short hair 

 

 IT’LL BE 3-1 TO LYON  

 

   

9.28 VOX POP 2 
(FRENCH) 
Man with white hair 

 

1-1. GOALS AND A GOOD SPECTACLE. 

    

9.31 First half 
Teams line up 
Mascot  
Kick off 

 And that’s exactly what was in store as both sides arrived in great 
form. Bordeaux had won their last 7 Champion’s League games 
but Lyon hadn’t lost at home… 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

    

9.41 
 

 

 

Feet and ball  
1 – 0 Lisandro 
Blanc arms folded on 
touchline 

 …during this campaign. And it was the hosts who set about 
maintaining their record. Lisandro Lopez doubled his goal tally for 
this term on 10 minutes to send the Stade Gerland into raptures. 
Laurent Blanc needed a response.  

    

9.54 1 – 1 Chamakh  And it came quickly. 4 minutes later Bordeaux were level. Once 
again the combination of Yoann Gourcuff and Marouane 
Chamakh brought about results. The Moroccan left in plenty of 
space to head in.  

    

10.07 Tackle  The pace was frenetic as the tackles were topping technique. 
    

10.12 Bordeaux chance  
Gouffran back heel/shot 
saved 

 And the visitors might have taken the lead – via a cheeky 
backheel from Yoan Gouffran. But Hugo Lloris was having none 
of it. The 23 year old keeper showcased exactly why he’s the 
French number one. 

    

10.24 2-1 Bastos  But someone else was about to steal the limelight. Delightful 
control and timing from Michel Bastos fooled everyone. Lyon were 
back in front. There was little to separate the sides and chances 
were aplenty. 

    

10.39 Bordeaux chance – 
Chamakh shot, Lloris saves 
2nd Half 
Puel watches on 

 Bordeaux though unable to capitalise on theirs.  Claude Puel the 
happier of the managers heading into break. The second half 
brought 

    

10.48 Tackle 
Bordeaux chance – great 
Lloris save 

 Yet more tough tackling as both sides began were getting 
frustrated.  Lyon were once more relying on their number one to 
get them out of trouble. The French champions were being stifled. 

    

11.01 Bordeaux chance – another 
great Lloris save from 
Chamakh header 
 

 Lloris proved impossible to penetrate.  

    

11.07 Fans  
Bordeaux chance – Lloris 
saves from freekick by 
Gourcuff 

 Gourcuff this time tried his luck - but there was to be no way 
through for the midfielder 

    



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

11.15 
 

 

Lyon chance – Makoun 
through against keeper  

 But Bordeaux were also demonstrating their miserly defence – the 
tightest of the tournament coming into this game having conceded 
just 3 goals 

    

11.23 Bordeaux chance – Wendel 
volley against crossbar 

 And just when Blanc’s charges had found a way through, the 
crossbar this time would intervene for Wendel -  

    

11.30 Govou tackle and booked 
(misses next game) 

 The Brazilian’s miss summing up their night. A late challenge 
would ruin substitute Sydney Govou’s evening though. His 3rd 
yellow card of the campaign means he won’t play a part for Lyon 
in the return. 

    

11.42 
 

Penalty incident 
3-1 Lisandro pen 
 

 But things would get a whole lot worse for Bordeaux. As the ball 
struck Mathieu Chalme’s arm the referee felt that warranted a 
penalty. Despite their protests Lisandro stepped up. 3-1 to Lyon.    

    

12.00 Scoreboard  
Lisandro tackle and booked 
(misses next game) 

 His two goals certainly enough on the night for Lyon but their star 
player won’t get the chance to score in Bordeaux. He too has one 
yellow card too many  

    

12.13 Lyon chance – cleared off 
line by Tremoulinas 
Fans at full time 
Players swapping shirts 

 There was still time for Benoit Tremoulinas to prevent Lyon 
inflicting further damage on Bordeaux. It’ll be the first time since 
2004 a French team are in the semis. Lyon are favourites now to 
take the honour. 

    

12.24 CLAUDE PUEL 
(FRENCH) 

 

IT’S JUST THE 1ST GAME. IT WAS A GOOD GAME OF 
FOOTBALL WITH A LOT OF INTENSITY AND QUALITY, 
THERE WERE PERIODS WHEN WE DOMINATED, THEN 
THERE WERE TIMES WHEN BORDEAUX WERE ON TOP.  

  

 

 

12.39 CEDRIC CARRASSO 
(FRENCH) 

 

WE MADE SOME SMALL MISTAKES THAT COST US 
DEARLY. BUT LOOKING AT THE GAME AS A WHOLE, I 
THINK WE COULD HAVE SCORED MORE GOALS. IT WAS A 
STRANGE GAME, BUT IT’S BE DECIDED OVER 2 MATCHES, 
SO WE’RE LOOKING FORWARD TO THE 2ND LEG. 

 

 

 

 

12.54   End 
    

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

TEASE 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

12.55 COMING UP STING  NO SCRIPT 
    

13.00 Honda b-roll 
Honda goal  
Honda kiss to cam 
Inter team celeb  

 Coming up…CSKA’s Keisuke Honda on the stiff task ahead in 
Italy.  

    

13.07 Munich flag  
99 Final handshakes  
Teams out 
Rooney chance 

 And we’re in Munich, for a repeat of one of the great Champions 
League Finals. 

    

13.11   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

WELCOME BACK 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

0.05 Scoreboard  
Arsenal v Barcelona post 
match celebs 
 

 Welcome back… we’ve seen 2 matches so far –  Arsenal’s 
comeback means they have it all to play for in Barcelona 

    

0.13 Lyon v Bordeaux post 
match celebs 

 While Lyon take a healthy lead to Bordeaux. All the rest of the 
action coming right up…. 

    

0.17   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

HONDA FEATURE 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

0.18 Map to Moscow  But first to a striker who has made an impressive start in a new 
country. 

    

0.25 Japan GVs + Honda in 
action for CSKA + Honda 
set ups 

 The bustling streets of Japan - hardly an historic hotbed of 
footballing talent. But for one of CSKA Moscow’s star men, this 
was where it all began. 

    

0.35 KEISUKE HONDA 
(JAPANESE)  

 WHEN I WAS YOUNG, I REMEMBER MY FATHER SHOWED 
ME A VIDEO OF AN OLD WORLD CUP MATCH. IT WAS A 
BLACK AND WHITE VIDEO AND MY FATHER MADE ME 
WATCH IT AGAIN AND AGAIN.  I FOUND IT REALLY COOL. I 
SUPPOSE IT WAS THE REASON THAT I STARTED 
FOOTBALL. 

    

0.56 Honda goal v Seville MD8b  Honda’s free kick proved decisive in the last round – albeit with a 
little help from Sevilla goal keeper Andres Palop.  

    

1.06 KEISUKE HONDA 
(JAPANESE) 
Celebs v Seville 

 

I AM SIMPLY PROUD OF WINNING THE GAME AGAINST 
SEVILLA. I’M PROUD OF GETTING A GOAL IN AN AWAY 
GAME, EVEN THOUGH IT WAS A LUCKY GOAL. 

 

 

 

 

1.20 Honda CSKA action 
montage + assist v Seville 
MD8b 

 After two years in Dutch football the Japanese international joined 
CSKA in January.  And so far the transition from west to east 
Europe has run incredibly smoothly. 

    

1.31 KEISUKE HONDA 
(JAPANESE)  
 

CSKA training plus Honda 
B roll 
 

 

Team line up 

 

THE MOST IMPORTANT THING FOR A PLAYER IS WHETHER 
YOU’VE GOT THE ENVIRONMENT THAT YOU CAN 
CONCENTRATE ON FOOTBALL.  IT IS GETTING WARM. I 
SAY “WARM”, BUT I SUPPOSE IT IS STILL AROUND 0 
DEGREES.  ALTHOUGH I CANNOT SPEAK RUSSIAN YET, I 
AM GETTING USED TO IT. MY FAMILY IS HERE TOO. 
ONCE I GET THE BASICS OF A LANGUAGE, IT IS MUCH 
EASIER TO BE IN EUROPE. MARC GONZALEZ AND I 
COMMUNICATE WELL WITH EACH OTHER, AS HE SPEAKS 
GOOD ENGLISH. HE MAY BE THE ONLY ONE AMONG MY 
OTHER RUSSIAN TEAM-MATES WHO I GOT ALONG WITH 
AS SOON AS I JOINED THE TEAM. 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

2.13 
 

 

Slutsky CU + CSKA goals 
from group stages 

 Coach Leonid Slutsky only took over mid-way through the group 
stage, but the 38-year-old has steered the Moscow club to the 
quarterfinals for the first time in their history. 

    

2.23 KEISUKE HONDA 
(JAPANESE)  
 

Slutsky training shots 

 

I FEEL HE IS THE KIND OF COACH WHO CONSIDERS 
RELATIONSHIPS AS VERY IMPORTANT. WE HAVE HAD 
TOUGH PRACTICE AT THE TRAINING CAMP AND THE TEAM 
HAS BONDED BY GETTING THROUGH IT TOGETHER. 
WITH HIM LEADING IT, HE HAS CREATED THAT SORT OF 
ATMOSPHERE. I THINK HE IS THE KIND OF COACH WHO 
LIKES TO KEEP THE PLAYERS QUITE CLOSE. 

 

 

 

 

2.43 Inter action v Chelsea 
MD7a 

 Jose Mourinho’s inter stand between CSKA and the semi’s. 
Honda though is relishing the trip to the San Siro. 

    

2.52 KEISUKE HONDA 
(JAPANESE) 
 

Honda training at San Siro 

 

IT IS THE STADIUM OF A TEAM I HAVE KNOWN ABOUT 
SINCE I WAS A CHILD. BUT IT’S THINKING LIKE THIS 
BEFORE THE MATCH WHICH COULD MEAN THAT I HAVE 
MENTALLY LOST THE GAME ALREADY.  MY HONEST 
FEELING IS OF COURSE I AM EXCITED AND THE STADIUM 
IS MY DREAM PLACE 

 

   

3.09 KEISUKE HONDA 
(JAPANESE)  
 

Honda + CSKA celebs v 
Seville 

 

I THINK RUSSIAN PEOPLE ARE REALLY EXCITED BECAUSE 
THIS IS THE FIRST TIME AT THIS STAGE FOR A RUSSIAN 
TEAM, AND THE SCENE IS GETTING REALLY ENERGETIC. 
BUT THE REACTION IS NOT REALLY AFFECTING ME. WE 
ARE A DEVELOPING TEAM. IF WE MANAGE TO GO ONE 
STEP HIGHER, WE WILL BE ABLE TO DEMONSTRATE OUR 
SKILLS, AS A MATURE TEAM, TO THE PEOPLE IN RUSSIA 
AND JAPAN. 

    

3.35   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

INTER v CSKA 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

3.36 Mourinho and inter training  Over in Milan – Jose Mourinho was certainly wary of the threat 
posed by Honda and co to his Inter team. 

    

3.42 JOSE MOURINHO 
(ITALIAN) 

 

I’M EXPECTING A VERY TIGHT GAME. A VERY DEFENSIVE 
GAME. FROM A TEAM THAT’LL BE LOOKING TO 
COUNTERATTACK, WHO’LL FORCE OUR TEAM TO PLAY 
WITH A VERY HIGH LEVEL OF CONCENTRATION, BECAUSE 
IT’S VERY HARD TO PLAY AGAINST THIS SORT OF TEAM, 
THEY’RE THE SORT OF TEAM I’D REALLY HAVE 
PREFERRED TO HAVE PLAYED IN MOSCOW FIRST. WHERE 
THEY’D HAVE NEEDED TO TAKE THE GAME TO US. 

 

 

 

 

4.06 Map to Inter v CSKA  NO SCRIPT 
 

 

 

 

4.09 Eto’o shot saved  Inter hadn’t lost at the San Siro all season so CSKA were in for a 
tough encounter. Samuel Eto’o tested Igor Akinfeev – his 
manager happy to have kept their hosts at bay for over an hour 

    

4.22 Milito goal and celebs  But as Inter dominated it was only a matter of time before they 
went ahead – Diego Milito with the goal.  Having taken both Porto 
and Chelsea to at least the semi’s, Mourinho’s progression with 
Inter was looking more assured. 

    

4.37 Berezutski clearance  The Italian side were peppering shots at goal and CSKA were 
being stretched further. Aleksei Berezutski with an outstanding 
clearance off the line. Mourinho expected more… 

    

4.50 Inter shot wide  …but CSKA were determined – Akinfeev proved resolute, Inter 
would only take a one goal advantage to the Luzhniki Stadium – a 
deserved win for Inter but the Russian side are far from out of the 
tie.   

    

5.05 JOSE MOURINHO 
(PORTUGUESE) 

 

IN THE SECOND HALF WE WERE ABLE TO PLAY QUICKER, 
WE FOUND MORE SPACE AND WERE ABLE TO MOVE THE 
BALL AT PACE. WE SCORED ONE GOAL BUT SHOULD 
HAVE SCORED MORE. WE COULD HAVE FINISHED THE TIE 
OFF TODAY BUT SADLY WEREN’T ABLE TO DO SO. 

    



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

5.16   End  
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

BAYERN MUNICH v MAN UNITED 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

5.17 Map to Munich  To Munich now, where memories of a famous night 11 years ago 
were at the forefront.   

    

5.24 Shot of the Alliance arena 
Bayern fan colour  

 United fans might still be basking in the glow of that last gasp 
triumph in Barcelona – but Bayern fans have rather more sombre 
recollections. 

    

5.34 VOX POP 1  
(GERMAN) 
Two men 

 

I REMEMBER IT WELL 

    

5.36 Bayern v Man U 
handshakes 
Basler goal  

 It all started so well for Bayern with an early Mario Basler goal. 

    

5.40 VOX POP 2  
(GERMAN)  
Young man with cap 

 

I WAS HAPPY WE WERE LEADING.  BUT AFTER 2-1 IT WENT 
WRONG. THAT WAS THE FINAL NAIL IN THE COFFIN.  
 

  

 

 

5.46 Sheringham goal  NO SCRIPT 
 

   

5.48 VOX POP 3 
(GERMAN) 
Man wearing red jacket 
Solskjaer goal  

 

IF THAT HAPPENED IN THE FIRST COUPLE OF MINUTES WE 
COULD HAVE ACCEPTED IT WAS OVER. BUT FOR IT TO 
HAPPEN IN THAT WAY WAS REALLY DISSAPOINTING, 
BECAUSE WE FEEL WE COULD’VE WON THE GAME. 

    

5.58 Man Utd post match celebs 
Upset Bayern players  

 It’s not just the fans who can’t forget that fateful night. Bayern’s 
most famous player – and a three time European champion, says 
it was unique.   

    

6.08 FRANZ BECKENBAUER 
(GERMAN)   
 

Post match scenes   

 

I HAVE BEEN IN FOOTBALL FOR OVER 50 YEARS BUT 
NEVER IN MY LIFE HAVE I SEEN A MATCH LIKE THAT, 
WHERE A TEAM ALREADY LOOKS LIKE THEY’VE WON IT, 
WHERE THE VICTORY IS SO CLOSE. YOU COULD ALMOST 
TOUCH IT WITH YOUR HANDS, AND TO LOSE THE CUP LIKE 
THAT IN EXTRA TIME WAS SO DRAMATIC AND SOMETHING 
THAT I HAD NEVER EXPERIENCED BEFORE.   

    



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

6.30 
 

 

VOX POP 4 
(GERMAN) 

 

MY TIP IS A 1-1 DRAW. IT WILL GO TO MANCHESTER. THEY 
WILL USE THEIR STRENGTH AT HOME AND WAYNE 
ROONEY WILL SCORE. 

    

6.39 Teams out  
Bayern Munich flag 
Kick off  
Van Gaal shot  

 Even Louis van Gaal accepted Manchester United would start 
favourites – especially with Arjen Robben out injured. Even more 
responsibility on Ribery and co. 

    

6.52 Evra cross  
Rooney goal 
Van Gal 
Scoreboard 1-0 

 But the Bayern boss hadn’t even sat down before his side fell 
behind – Valencia’s free-kick…the punishment for leaving Rooney 
unmarked is a heavy one.  His 34th goal of the season – 66 
seconds in. 

    

7.05 Pranjic forces good save 
from Van der Sar  
Sir Alex Ferguson reaction  

 Bayern had lost their unbeaten domestic home record at the 
weekend and threatened only sporadically. Pranjic’s shot barely 
threatened Van der Sar. Even so… 

    

7.14 Rooney chance  and 
reaction 

 Sir Alex wanted the insurance of a second…and Rooney almost 
provided it. Hans-Jorg Butt with the save. 

    

7.21 Half time – both teams off 
pitch  

 Still, advantage United at the break. 

    

7.29 2nd half kick off  
Olic chance  

 Bayern needed Ribery to run the game – and he started to get 
busy – Van der Sar denied the dangerous Croatian Ivica Olic. 

    

7.40 Neville handball and he’s 
yellow carded  

 Inside the last quarter of an hour and Gary Neville literally handed 
Bayern a lifeline. Only one man the crowd wanted to take it. 
 

    

7.48 Fans chant Ribery’s name   NO SCRIPT 
    

7.52 Ribery goal 1-1 
Ribery celeb 
Scoreboard  

 It wasn’t his best – but a deflection off Rooney left Van der Sar 
stranded. The outpouring of emotion was as raw as the Bavarian 
winter – Bayern were back. 

    

8.04 Vidic hits post and Van Gal 
reaction 

 But almost behind again straight away – Vidic left cursing the 
crossbar. 

    

8.10 Gomez chance   But the hosts had the momentum - Mario Gomez came off the 
bench and almost straight onto the scoresheet. 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

    

8.19 
 

Gomez pass leads to Olic 
goal 2-1 
Olic celeb 

 Then in stoppage time what could prove a priceless winner – 
Gomez’s run, Evra’s hesitancy, Olic’s calm, composed finish. For 
their second half display alone the 4-time European champions 
fully deserved their lead. 

    

8.37 Rooney on the floor,  
Replay Rooney injury 
 

 And it was to get even worse for United – Rooney hurt...the 
England striker could barely stand. It was later diagnosed as 
minor ligament damage – he’ll be out for 4 up to weeks. 

    

8.52 Rooney hobbles off the 
pitch FT celebs  
Bayern fans  
Bayern team wave to 
crowd  

 Which means he’ll miss the second leg at Old Trafford – when 
Bayern will need more of the same to secure a place in the last 
four for the first time in nine long years. 

    

9.06 FRANCK RIBERY 
(FRENCH)  

 

THE FIRST HALF WAS A BIT DIFFICULT BECAUSE WE 
WERE THINKING ABOUT THAT FIRST GOAL, AND AGAINST 
A TEAM LIKE MANCHESTER UNITED, THAT’S NOT EASY. 
THEY’RE A FANTASTIC TEAM, SO I THINK THAT THIS 
EVENING’S WIN WILL DO US A LOT OF GOOD. 

 

   

9.19 DARREN FLETCHER 
(ENGLISH)  

 

THE AWAY GOAL IS GOING TO BE IMPORTANT AS I’VE 
SAID BEFORE, WE FANCY OUR CHANCES AGAINST 
ANYONE AT OLD TRAFFORD. WE GOT A GOOD LOOK AT 
BAYERN TONIGHT. THEY’RE A GOOD SIDE BUT AS I SAID 
BEFORE AT OLD TRAFFORD WE FANCY OUR CHANCES 
AGAINST ANYONE.  

 

   

9.29 MARIO GOMEZ 
(GERMAN)  
Rooney leaving on 
crutches 
 

 

FOR ROONEY, THIS IS REALLY TOUGH. HE IS IN THE FORM 
OF HIS LIFE. HE HAS NEVER PLAYED SO WELL. HE HAS AN 
INCREDIBLE GOALSCORING RECORD. YOU DON’T WANT 
THIS TO HAPPEN TO ANY FELLOW PLAYERS. I HOPE HE 
RECOVERS SOON AND THE INJURY ISN’T SERIOUS.  

    

9.40 Rooney leaves in car   NO SCRIPT  
    

9.48   End 
    

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 25 – 02.04.10 
 

CLOSER 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

9.49 Various CL action   So a week of high drama in the Champions League with all the 
matches finely balanced, and the semi finals beckoning. Next time 
we’ll bring you the action that matters from all the second leg ties. 
Join us then. 

    

10.18   End

data.summary:
* Lieu indéterminé, Londres : 20100402 et archives, parcours de l'équipe nationale de football d'Angleterre dans les éliminatoires de la Coupe du Monde de football 2010 en Afrique du Sud, entraînée par l'entraîneur italien CAPELLO Fabio
* Lieu indéterminé : 20100402, réactions de footballeurs grecs et de leur entraîneur allemand REHHAGEL Otto sur le parcours de l'équipe nationale de Grèce lors du parcours des éliminatoires de la Coupe du monde 2010 en Afrique du Sud.
scripts:
2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 1 

ROAD TO THE 2010 FIFA WORLD CUP™ 

EPISODE 7 
Play-out: 2 April 2010; 14:00 GMT 

 

SCRIPT 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

10:00:31 Trophy Welcome once again as we continue our journey to 

the 2010 FIFA World Cup™ to be held in South 

Africa in June. 

   
10:00:39 Capello 

training/steadicam 

This week we focus on two more countries from 

the European zone – first up England who, under 

Italian coach Fabio Capello are a side transformed.  

   
10:00:52 Teams-out v 

Ukraine 

The team qualified in some style for the finals 

finishing as top scorers in the region. Leading that 

goal-fest was Wayne Rooney – could he be the 

inspiration behind a charge towards the country’s 

second FIFA World Cup™ triumph?  

   
10:01:09 Greek fans’ 

celebrations 

Four decades have passed since England lifted a 

major trophy but Greece were champions of 

Europe just six years ago.  

   
10:01:17 Upset Greek players Elation turned to bitter disappointment though as 

the unlikely winners of Euro 2004 failed to qualify 

for the FIFA World Cup™ in Germany two years 

ago. 
   
10:01:27 Rehhagel and 

celebs 

But now, the Greeks are back at football’s premier 

event and their veteran coach Otto Rehhagel will 

be desperate to repeat the shock success of 2004. 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 2 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

10:01:45 Group table GFX England are likely to be favourites to top Group C 

where they will face the USA, Algeria and Slovenia. 

   
10:01:53 Fixtures GFX Their opening match is against the Americans in 

Rustenburg, six days later they face Algeria in 

Cape Town, before making the short hop to Nelson 

Mandela Bay for the game against Slovenia on 

June the 23rd. 

   
10:02:07 Euro qualifier v 

Croatia 

 

 

The 21st November 2007 was one of the darkest 

days in recent English football history. Steve 

McClaren’s team failed to qualify for Euro 2008 

from a group that many commentators considered 

too easy – one that would provide little real 

practice for the rigours of the Championship to be 

held in Austria and Switzerland. A 3-2 home defeat 

by Croatia finally brought the curtain down on the 

coach’s reign; McClaren was sacked the following 

morning.  
   
10:02:36 Wembley aerial The 14th December 2007, and enter a new hope.  

   
10:02:43 Capello The English FA once again turned to a foreign 

coach to lift a generation of talented stars out of 

their slump – Like Sven-Göran Eriksson before him 

Italian, Fabio Capello needed to satisfy an 

expectant nation that wasn’t his own. 

   
10:03:02 SOT: FABIO 

CAPELLO  

(ENGLISH) 

 

DURING TRAINING I SAW FANTASTIC 

PLAYERS, TECHNICALLY, PHYSICALLY AND 

WITH SPIRIT BUT WHEN WE PLAYED 

AGAINST SWITZERLAND IN MY FIRST GAME 

AT WEMBLEY I UNDERSTOOD THAT I NEEDED 

TO WORK A LOT ON THE MINDS OF THE 

PLAYERS 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 3 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

10:03:26 England training 

 

 

The Italian’s impact was not immediate, his first 

2010 FIFA World Cup qualifier™ was an 

underwhelming 2-0 win over minnows Andorra – it 

was in the next game that the change Capello’s 

leadership had brought became apparent.  

   
10:03:41 SOT: FABIO 

CAPELLO  

(ENGLISH) 

 

AFTER THE CROATIA GAME THE TEAM WAS A 

DIFFERENT TEAM. AFTER THIS GAME THE 

CONFIDENCE OF THE FANS HERE AT 

WEMBLEY BECAME REALLY IMPORTANT FOR 

THE CONFIDENCE OF THE PLAYERS. 
   
10:04:01 SOT JOHN TERRY 

(ENGLISH) 

SINCE THE MANAGER HAS COME IN HE HAS 

SET THE STANDARD VERY HIGH, HE HAS 

CHANGED A FEW THINGS TACTICALLY AND I 

THINK FROM THE VERY FIRST GAME WE 

LOOKED A LOT BETTER AS A GROUP, WE 

WERE ALL WORKING FOR EACH OTHER AND 

WE GOT A FEW GOOD RESULTS. AFTER THOSE 

FEW GOOD RESULTS CAME CONFIDENCE 

AFTER THAT THE TOGETHERNESS WAS THERE 

AND THEN, AFTER THAT WE WENT FROM 

STRENGTH TO STRENGTH AND WE’RE 

LOOKING VERY GOOD AT THE MOMENT AS 

WELL. 
   
10:04:22 Lampard CU 

 

 

Like any top international team, especially a nation 

that is home to one of the most popular domestic 

leagues in the world there is huge pressure on 

England’s players – but just how reasonable is it 

for the fans and media to expect so much from a 

country that has only won the FIFA World Cup™ 

once, as hosts in 1966?  
   



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 4 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

10:04:53 SOT: GARETH 

BARRY 

(ENGLISH) 

THEY WANT THEIR COUNTRY TO WIN 

THINGS, TO WIN WORLD CUPS, TO WIN 

EUROPEAN CHAMPIONSHIPS, TO WIN EVERY 

GAME. ENGLAND HAS A LOT OF TOP PLAYERS 

AND THE TARGET SHOULD BE AT THE 

HIGHTEST LEVEL. 

   
10:05:08 SOT: STEVEN 

GERRARD 

(ENGLISH) 

YOU HAVE TO DEAL WITH THE PRESSURE 

AND EXPECTATION OF PLAYING FOR 

ENGLAND, THE MEDIA AND THE SUPPORTERS 

ARE VERY PASSIONATE ABOUT THE COUNTRY 

SO WE KNOW THERE IS GOING TO BE A LOT 

EXPECTED OF US SO IT’S IMPORTANT THAT 

AS PLAYERS WE TRY TO COPE WITH THAT IN 

THE BEST WAY WE CAN. 

   
10:05:29 2006 Rooney sent 

off 

 

 

Four years ago in Germany the team failed once 

again to live up to the expectations of the English 

media and fans – Wayne Rooney’s petulance in the 

quarter- final left the team with ten men and 

preceded another shoot-out failure. 

   
10:05:51 COMMENTARY 

UPSOT 

AND ENGLAND, AS USUAL LOSE ON A 

PENALTY SHOOTOUT. 

   
10:05:58 Rio Ferdinand 

 

 

A nation knocked out of major tournaments via 

penalties four times in the previous 16 years once 

again suffered heartbreak.    

   
10:06:08 Wembley aerial  This though is a new England and a new Wayne 

Rooney.  
   
10:06:19 Fans Currently enjoying the form of his career, the fall-

guy of Germany 2006 has been instrumental in 

England’s qualification. 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 5 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

10:06:27 SOT: FABIO 

CAPELLO 

(ENGLISH) 

ROONEY IS AN INCREDIBLE PLAYER. 

SOMETIMES DURING TRAINING I SAY TO 

HIM, “ROONEY, YOU HAVE TO STOP 

TRAINING, GO TO THE DRESSING ROOM”, 

HE’LL SAY “NO, NO, I WANT TO STAY HERE” I 

SAY “ROONEY, PLEASE, THIS IS A GOOD 

MOMENT TO STOP, PLEASE GO TO THE 

CHANGING ROOMS” HE’LL SAY “NO, NO, NO, 

I PREFER TO STAY HERE”. HE’S A REALLY 

FANTASTIC PLAYER AND HE WANTS TO 

TRAIN EVERY DAY TO IMPROVE. HE IS ONE 

OF THE BEST PLAYERS I HAVE TRAINED IN 

MY LIFE. 
   
10:07:07 Fans At the halfway stage another brave performance 

maintained England’s perfect record. The type of 

match that, so often in the past had caused failure 

and recrimination now ended in triumph as a 

difficult Ukraine team were beaten 2-1  

   
10:07:35 SOT: FABIO 

CAPELLO 

(ENGLISH) 

UKRAINE HAD SCORED A GOAL THROUGH 

SHEVCHENKO, MORE OR LESS AT THE END OF 

THE GAME, MAYBE TEN MINUTES FROM THE 

END BUT THE REACTION FROM THE PLAYERS 

ON THE PITCH WAS FANTASTIC AND WE 

SCORED A GOAL IN THE LAST MINUTE. 

   
10:07:55 SOT: STEVEN 

GERRARD 

(ENGLISH) 

I THINK IF YOU LOOK AT THE WHOLE 

CAMPAIGN WE WERE VERY CONSISTENT, WE 

WERE A DIFFICULT TEAM TO BEAT AND WE 

PUT IN SOME VERY GOOD PERFORMANCES 

BUT THE MOST IMPORTANT THING IS THAT 

WE STILL NEED TO KEEP TRYING TO 

IMPROVE AND WORK HARD. WE KNOW 

WE’RE STRONG, WE KNOW WE HAVE  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 6 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

  FANTASTIC PLAYERS BUT THE CHALLENGE 

NOW IS CAN WE GO AND DO IT? CAN WE 

KEEP EVERYONE FIT AND PERFORM TO THE 

MAXIMUM OF OUR ABILITY? IF WE DO, WE 

HAVE GOT AS CHANCE. 

   
10:08:35 Gerrard header Confidence was never more in evidence than when 

England entertained Croatia once again at 

Wembley. Almost two years after missing out on 

Euro 2008 England now had the chance to exorcise 

their demons and seal qualification for South 

Africa. 
   
10:08:55 Rooney goal The symmetry of earning their place against 

Croatia will not have been lost on the Italian or his 

team – but he’ll be hoping to avoid any further 

historical poignancies in South Africa! 

   
10:09:06 Black and white 

footage 

 

 

The draw has been kind to England but their first 

opponents in the group phase are the USA – the 

last time the two teams met competitively was at 

the 1950 FIFA World Cup™ where the amateurs 

from the USA defeated the professional English 

team 1-0. 

   
10:09:26 SOT: JOHN TERRY 

(ENGLISH) 

LOOKING AT THE USA GAME I THINK THAT’S 

GOING TO BE A VERY TOUGH GAME, I THINK 

THE IMPROVEMENT OVER THERE AND THEIR 

PLAYERS HAS COME ON LEAPS AND BOUNDS 

OVER THE LAST FOUR OR FIVE YEARS SO THE 

PLAYERS AND THE MANAGER WILL NOT BE 

TAKING THE GAME LIGHTLY. 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 7 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

10:09:40 SOT: STEVEN 

GERRARD 

(ENGLISH) 

I THINK WE’RE PLEASED WITH THE DRAW, 

WE’RE VERY CONFIDENT THAT WE CAN 

QUALIFY AND GET OUT OF THAT GROUP BUT 

AT THE SAME TIME YOU HAVE GOT TO SHOW 

THESE TEAMS RESPECT. 

   
10:09:50 Beckham One potential fly in the ointment for England will 

be the absence of David Beckham. The veteran 

midfielder ruptured his Achilles tendon while on 

loan at AC Milan and, whilst the 34 year-old is no 

longer a starter for his country, his dead-ball 

prowess could be sorely missed come June. 

Capello still has a wealth of talent available and 

despite fitness doubts over key personnel like 

Ashley Cole the Italian will hope to make history 

by becoming the first manager to win the FIFA 

world Cup™ for a country that isn’t his own.

screen  

In May 2009, SA Tourism launched a dance to 

celebrate the FIFA World Cup™ – named after 

South African township slang for football – “diski”.   

   
10:11:35 Group of dancers The Diski Dance was invented by Johannesburg-

based choreographer, Wendy Ramokgadi.  We met 

up with him to find out more. 
   
10:11:45 SOT:WENDY 

RAMOKGADI 

(English)

WANT TO SHOW THE WORLD THAT WE ARE 

PASSIONATE ABOUT SPORTS - THE DISKI 

DANCE, WHICH IS SA TOURISM’S CONCEPT.  

OK GUYS – LET’S GO FOR IT!

– and it has quickly gained popularity among 

ordinary South Africans… everyone from hotel staff 

to construction workers at the stadia is doing the 

Diski…!

missable during the FIFA World Cup™.

chapters.excerpt: * Jura (canton) : 20100401 et archives, les autorités cantonales ont décidé de soutenir la formation des médecins de famille en proposant deux places de stage pour les futurs médecins généralistes et cela afin de lutter contre le manque de médecins dans les régions périphériques. Le cursus, financé par le canton, se déroulera à l'hôpital du canton et dans un cabinet médical de la région.
* Brigue : 20100401, condamnation de l'ex-chef de la gendarmerie pour actes sexuels répétés sur une adolescente mineure entre 2008 et 2009. Le procès a eu lieu le 20100324 à huis clos.

* Berne-ville : 20100401 et archives, le PLR et l'UDC soutiennent l'initiative populaire fédérale MINDER Thomas "contre les rémunérations abusives". L'initiative populaire demande que les actionnaires puissent voter pour les rémunérations du Conseil d'administration et interdit les indemnités de départ des patrons de banques. Les deux partis politiques souhaitent que des lois internationales réglementent les salaires des responsables des grandes banques.

* Fribourg-ville : 20100401, le siège de voiture pour enfant est désormais obligatoire dès le 20100401 pour les enfants jusqu'à 12 ans à l'arrière d'une automobile. La famille KOLLY s'est équipé d'un rehausseur pour l'une de ses filles afin de respecter la nouvelle réglementation.

chapters.title: BAB - 10.04.01
chapters.excerpt: * Zoug-ville : 20100401, défaite de Genève Servette HC face au EV Zoug sur le score de 1 but à 2 après prolongations lors du 4e match des demi-finales des play-offs du championnat suisse de hockey sur glace LNA. Genève Servette HC et EV Zoug sont à égalité 2 à 2 dans ces play-offs.

chapters.title: BAB - 10.04.01
chapters.excerpt: * Kloten : 20100401, victoire du CP Berne face aux Kloten Flyers sur le score de 3 buts à 2 lors du 4e match des demi-finales des play-offs du championnat suisse de hockey sur glace LNA. Le CP Berne est qualifié pour la finale des play-offs.

chapters.title: BAB - 10.04.01
chapters.excerpt: * Langnau im Emmental : 20100401, victoire des SC Langnau Tigers qui ont battu le HC Bienne sur le score de 6 buts à 3 lors du 4e match de la finale des play-outs du championnat suisse de hockey sur glace LNA. Le HC Bienne et les SC Langnau Tigers sont à égalité 2 partout dans cette finale.

chapters.title: BAB - 10.04.01
chapters.excerpt: * Prilly : 20100401, victoire du Lausanne HC qui a battu le HC Viège sur le score de 2 buts à 1 après prolongations lors du 4e match de la finale des play-offs du championnat suisse de hockey sur glace LNB. Le Lausanne HC mène par 3 à 1 dans cette série.

chapters.title: BAB - 10.04.01
chapters.excerpt: * Bâle-ville : 20100401, victoire du FC Bâle qui s'est imposé sur le score de 4 à 3 face au FC Sion lors d'un match de la 28e journée du championnat de Suisse de football de Super league.

chapters.title: BAB - 10.04.01
chapters.excerpt: * Zurich-ville : 20100401, match nul 1 à 1 entre le FC Zurich et le FC St-Gall lors d'un match de la 28e journée du championnat de Suisse de football de Super league.

chapters.title: BAB - 10.04.01
chapters.excerpt: * Bellinzone : 20100401, victoire de Grasshopper qui s'est imposé sur le score de 2 à 1 face à l'AC Bellinzone lors d'un match de la 28e journée du championnat de Suisse de football de Super league.

chapters.excerpt: * Brigue : 20100401, condamnation de l'ex-chef de la gendarmerie pour actes sexuels répétés sur une adolescente mineure entre 2008 et 2009. Le procès a eu lieu le 20100324 à huis clos.
chapters.remarks: SUJET PRESENT UNIQUEMENT SUR LE TEMOIN.

chapters.excerpt: * Porrentruy : 20100401, des cours de sensibilisation au surendettement ont été mis sur pieds dans les écoles jurassiennes afin de prévenir les dépenses excessives chez les jeunes adolescents qui consomment trop et qui n'en n'ont pas les moyens financiers. Les risques et les conséquences d'un surendettement sont expliqués aux étudiants afin d'éviter des dettes à ces jeunes encore aux études.
chapters.remarks: SUJET EGALEMENT DIFFUSE DANS L'EMISSION PATROUILLE DES GLACIERS DU 20100424

chapters.excerpt: * Bienne : Centrale de Viasuisse, 20100401, SINGH Varuna mène des itw à la Centrale d'information routière Viasuisse qui renseigne les automobilistes sur l'état de la circulation routière en Suisse sur les grands axes. A la veille des départs pour les vacances de Pâques, les automobilistes peuvent ainsi connaître l'étendue des bouchons routiers.

* Neuchâtel : 20100401, immersion dans un élevage de poules de la région à la veille des fêtes de Pâques. Le producteur d'oeufs SCHREYER André veille à ce que toutes ses poules aient le meilleur rendement journalier afin de pouvoir fournir les commerçants des marchés de primeurs.
* Martigny, Le Grand-St-Bernard : 20100401, portrait du président du FC Sion CONSTANTIN Christian s'entraînant avec ses coéquipiers pour la Patrouille des Glaciers 2010.

data.title: Que veut dire Pâques en 2010? Quel sens lui donner? : Interview de Claire Clivaz, théologienne et pasteure, professeure de Nouveau Testament à l'Université de Lausanne
data.summary: Le dimanche de Pâques est le jour le plus saint du calendrier chrétien. Pâques aux multiples significations, la sortie d'Egypte, la crucifixion du Christ, sa résurrection, le passage de la mort à la vie. Claire Clivaz est l'auteur de "L'ange et la sueur de sang" (Ed. Peeters, 2010). Contient également la "Chronique" de Charles Wyplosz  et la "Revue de presse" de Jean-François Moulin et de Stéphane Deleury.
